meanings.definition: A type of corduroy fabric with a very fine ribbed texture.
meanings.sent1: The tailor used pinwale to make a soft and comfortable jacket.
meanings.sent2: She loved the feel of the pinwale fabric against her skin.
meanings.sent3: The pinwale material was so cozy that it made everyone want to snuggle up.
meanings.sent4: The pinwale fabric hugged her like a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The pinwale texture was as smooth as a gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: To create a pinwheel shape or design.
meanings.sent1: He decided to pinwale the paper to make a colorful decoration.
meanings.sent2: The children pinwaled their drawings to display them on the wall.
meanings.sent3: She tried to pinwale the dough into a perfect circle but ended up with a funny shape instead.
meanings.sent4: The artist pinwaled the colors together to form a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The wind pinwaled the leaves in a swirling dance.
